item.title: Dungeon Crawler Carl Hardcover Editions - Save On The Best-Selling LitRPG
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dungeon-crawler-carl-hardcover-editions-save-on-the-best-selling-litrpg/1100-6529959/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Dungeon Crawler Carl is one of the most popular series in the LitRPG space, a burgeoning subgenre of fantasy and sci-fi that injects video game tropes like stats, health bars, and inventory screens into prose novels. Written by Matt Dinniman, the series has become a mainstream hit over the past few years; the seventh novel in the series, The Inevitable Ruin, is currently in Amazon's top 10 most-read books of the week. Fans can soon add eye-catching hardcover editions of three more Dungeon Crawler Carl books to their collection.

While Dinniman continues to self-publish paperback and ebook versions of the series, Penguin Random House imprint Ace began releasing hardcover editions of the Dungeon Crawler Carl series last fall. The first three books are currently available in hardcover format, and the next three are up for preorder at Amazon.

Dungeon Crawler Carl Series

  1. Dungeon Crawler Carl (Hardcover) -- $20.30 ($30)
  2. Carl's Doomsday Scenario (Hardcover) -- $26.20 ($30)
  3. The Dungeon Anarchist's Cookbook (Hardcover)-- $22.34 ($30)
  4. The Gate of the Feral Gods (Hardcover) -- $25 ($30) | Releases March 11
  5. The Butcher's Masquerade (Hardcover) -- $20.49 ($35) | Releases April 8
  6. The Eye of the Bedlam Bride (Hardcover) -- $34 ($39) | Releases May 13
  7. The Inevitable Ruin - Only available in Paperback, Audible, or Kindle ebook for now

If you're new to the series: Dungeon Carl Crawler is a quintessential example of the LitRPG genre. When bored aliens transform Earth into a giant video-game style dungeon, Coast Guard veteran Carl becomes a participant in a life-or-death tournament. Carl is accompanied by a cat named Princess Donut. Throughout the series, the duo squares off against a wide array of monsters and solves puzzles. In case the name Princess Donut didn't give it away, Dungeon Crawler Carl doesn't take itself too seriously. Despite the high stakes, the series frequently leans into the ridiculousness of the scenario with darkly humorous dialogue and over-the-top violence.

You can start your journey with Carl and Princess Donut by picking up the hardcover edition of Dungeon Crawler Carl (Book 1) for $20.30 (was $30) at Amazon.

The upcoming hardcover editions follow the same release schedule as the first three novels: Ace is publishing one hardcover per month for the next three months. The Gate of the Feral Gods (Book 4) releases March 11 and is available to preorder for $25 (was $30) at Amazon. You can save even more on Book 5, as preorders for The Butcher's Masquerade are discounted to $20.49 (was $35) ahead of its April 8 release. Book 6, The Eye of the Bedlam Bride, will be published in hardcover on May 13, and preorders are up for grabs for $34 (was $39).

If you're wondering why the retail prices are higher for later books in the series, it's likely related to page count. Books 1 and 2 were 464 and 384 pages, respectively, whereas Book 5 is 720 pages and Book 6 is the longest book in the series at 832 pages.

Check out the cover art for all six hardcover editions below. Below the hardcovers, you'll find details about the latest book in the series and alternative formats, including Kindle ebook and Audible audiobook versions.

  • Suikoden HD Remaster Collection Is Steeply Discounted For PC On Launch Day
  • Zelda Master Sword Replica On Sale For Big Discount At Amazon
  • Spider-Man X Magic: The Gathering Trading Card Set Is Available To Preorder
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • The Biggest Upcoming Games That You Can Preorder Now
  • SanDisk 1.5TB MicroSD Card Is Steeply Discounted At Amazon - Expand Your Steam Deck Storage
  • Xbox Series X|S Owners Can Save Big On Western Digital's 1TB Expansion Card
  • Amazon-Exclusive Pokemon TCG Premium Collection Gets Huge Limited-Time Discount
  • Lord Of The Rings Trilogy Limited Edition Steelbook Box Set Returns Next Month

item.title: WWE 2K25 Locker Codes List
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wwe-2k25-locker-codes/1100-6529980/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

WWE 2K25 locker codes are back for another year, giving players in MyFaction the ability to unlock some free rewards by entering simple codes in-game. These change often and typically expire, so we'll update this list as often as needed so you can track the latest WWE 2K codes. We'll also walk you through how to enter the codes in-game, in case this is your first time doing it in WWE 2K or if you're new to the MyFaction card-chasing mode.

How to redeem WWE 2K25 locker codes

It's simple to enter your WWE 2K25 codes. Just follow these steps:

  • Open MyFaction mode from within WWE 2K25
  • Scroll to the Live section of the menus
  • Select Locker Codes
  • Type in your code
  • If the code is valid and requires opening packs, scroll to the Store tab and select Unopened Packs

That's it! Next we'll move on to all active codes right now.

WWE 2K25 locker codes - March 2025

At the time of writing, there's just one locker code active for WWE 2K25, but it's a fun one. You can earn a toy version of The Rock with the code, but take notice of its expiration date. This is definitely one for the game's earliest adopters.

WWE 2K25 CODEREWARDEXPIRATION DATE
ELITEROCK2K25Mattel "Elite" The Rock Persona CardMarch 16, 2025

As time goes on and more codes become available, we'll add (or subtract, as needed) WWE 2K codes for you to check out, so bookmark this page and come back often.

If you want more help as you dive into WWE 2K25, don't miss the 2K25 Showcase matches list and rewards, as well as the full 300-person WWE 2K25 roster, including DLC characters coming soon.

Mark Delaney on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Spelunky 2 Gets Surprise PS5 Version With A Crucial Update--If You Can Take Advantage Of It
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/spelunky-2-gets-surprise-ps5-version-with-a-crucial-update-if-you-can-take-advantage-of-it/1100-6529979/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The beloved roguelike platformer Spelunky 2 was released in 2020 for PlayStation 4, and a native PS5 version just dropped yesterday, March 6.

While the PS4 version can back played on PS5 via backwards compatibility, the PS5 version has one crucial upgrade, as noted by Polygon. It can also run at a blazing-fast 120fps, provided that your monitor or TV has the capability to show those frames. Those extra frames could be the difference between victory and defeat in an unforgiving game like Spelunky 2.

Spelunky 2 costs $20 on PSN. Fortunately, those who already own Spelunky 2 on PS4 can simply upgrade to the PS5 version for free. The game also has cross-play to its online multiplayer functions, so players can join up with others from different platforms.

Spelunky 2 already had a current-gen version with Xbox Series X|S, and now PS5 has joined that category. The game is also on Nintendo Switch, but it's unknown whether a native Switch 2 version will come, as Nintendo's upcoming console has some backwards compatibility restrictions.

Spelunky 2 revolves around Ana Spelunky, the daughter of Spelunky's protagonist, Guy Spelunky. After her parents go missing, Ana goes on a journey to the moon in order to find them.

In GameSpot's Spelunky 2 review, we said, "Spelunky 2 is a successful evolution of what made the original Spelunky work; the tight controls, impressive use of procedural generation, expressive art style, and interesting stage themes are better than ever here."

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
